page.title: 13FARMING
page.content: In Coldean there is alot of forestry land,and ost of it belongs to parks, i.e:Wild Park and Stanmer Park.There are five farms in the area:Court Farm, Housedean Farm,Balmer Farm,St Mary's Farm and Stanmer Farm,just off of the A27 and owned by the council.The area is quite hilly,so the five farms raise livestock as well as groing crops.The main crop which is grown is barley, both winter barley and summer barley. It is used as animal food.The only cattle and sheep farm is Stanmer. Crops are grown more because of the good climate in the South of England. Some other crops are wheat and silage. The farmland in Stanmer park is under the eye of the county council to place part of the proposed Brighton By-pass in the park,and it could destroy a park which has good farming prospects. By Liza Hawkins and Ian Codling.
